was the collective trade union in Nazi Germany, but instead of representing 
the workers, it really benefitted the big businessmen.  At the time, cars 
in Germany were only expensive, luxurious cars and the average German could 
afford a motorcycle, at the most.  As a result, only one in 50 people had a 
car.  Hitler then started up a ''people's car'' project so that Germans 
could get across the country easier, as well with the Autobahn, or 
motorway.  And that's also what Volkswagen means-people's car.﻿

There is plenty of money in porn, don't see MGM and the legit production 
companies, directors, actors, etc. Getting into that. 
There is plenty of money in illicit drugs, Big Pharma turns that down on a 
regular basis. 
Funerals are not making money off the dead, they are making money off 
giving families comfort, compassion. 
Vets make almost nothing off putting animals down, and animals are not 
people. They are animals. Even so they put them down with little to no 
pain. 
Your talking about companies that got in bed with entirely immoral 
practices. Violated every ethical code there is, including business ethics. 
This was not making money off of death, it was profiteering off of mass 
genocide, rape, torture, etc. 
Again your argument is moot. If they didn't someone else would? That is 
EXACTLY what heroin and crack dealers tell people to justify selling to 
pregnant women and little kids. Thats what child pornographers and people 
that pimp under age girls and boys say to excuse their actions. If they 
didn't someone else would. 
Well if everyone using that excuse stopped excusing it, and just didn't do 
it...no one would do it.
And just because your competition is willing to sell their soul and be 
immoral, doesn't mean when you do it you have nothing to apologize for. 
IBM, Hugo Boss, etc...they do have a lot to apologize for. Fortunately 
Germany does hold itself and others accountable for their actions unlike 
the US who just makes excuses, Germany pays reperations which by no means 
absolves their behavior, but they also outlawed that Aryan bullshit even 
publicly supported. 
And yes when you sell a product or service to someone, your condoning and 
supporting what they do. Your what keeps them doing it by supplying the 
resources. 
You argument is flat and without any merit. The way your wording it seems 
to be for emotional effect, shock value, I now have to assume young troll, 
that your just a punk behind their mothers basement computer looking for 
reactions to fill your empty life. Try getting friends offline who have 
never heard the term Mana. Try getting a job. There is so much out there to 
fill your life with that is so much better than hate and drama.
Pussy. That shit is amazing. Get you some pussy. You'll have to knock off 
all this shit, get out of your mommas basement...but trust me pussy is 
worth it.
comments.author: matthew Foley

comments.text:
+matthew Foley Walk away from money? Said no business ever. But then I 
could make a slightly different example to condone it, take a funeral 
related business, i.e. coffin makers, now they clearly profit off death as 
well. You could quite easily call that blood money too even if it's from a 
different sense. Even vets profit from the costs to euthanize animals. 
Where there is a gap in the market, business will always be there... At the 
time killing jews was the norm in Germany and thus there were business gaps 
in the market. Selling to those people still doesn't mean they condone what 
their buyers are doing. If they chose to not make whatever, then someone 
else would simply replace them and their market.
comments.author: TheDaneist

comments.text:
That's different then say, IBM who made the coding and ID system used for 
tattooing and imprisoning folks in the concentration camps. 
And yeah. Involvement at that level, needs to be addressed with an apology 
of accountability. Your logic would reason that selling crack to little 
kids is okay, so long as all your competitors are doing it and it makes you 
money. When you know how immoral something is, you walk from that. Its 
blood money.
comments.author: matthew Foley

comments.text:
Interestingly, Krupp did this, sold weapons to everyone. And professed 
child-like innocence after the war
comments.author: Liza Tanzawa

comments.text:
+Andrew Beeter Then what was your point to begin with, you were emphasizing 
that he joined the Nazi party very early on which to me suggested that your 
belief was that he was a devout follower of the Nazi regime. Even logically 
I cannot see how a businessmen would benefit from killing possible 
consumers. Lets also not forget that Jews were the richest consumers in 
Germany. Also I'm taking what you say at face value, and you are talking as 
if you were there with Hugo Boss yourself. I mean you can't be naive enough 
to truly believe everything surrounding Nazi Germany, and forced labour? 
Must be much different to what Nike, Reebok and other famous clothing 
brands were doing in China. Do I condone it? Of course not but there are 
many companies who have used slave labour and AFTER the Nazi fact so 
clearly history didn't teach them anything. He was not a supporter to the 
cause, probably (like most Germans) a supporter to living.
comments.author: TheDaneist

comments.text:
+Andrew Beeter When he joined doesn't matter at all, that doesn't mean he 
was any less forced into the scenario. Maybe he took advantage of the 
situation but that just makes him a good businessmen not a Jew hunter.
comments.author: TheDaneist

comments.text:
+Gavin Gill To start with I was simply musing about the matter and I don't 
think I've once mentioned anything about Russel let alone negative 
comments. I also agree in believing he is intelligent but he almost masks 
it consistently with a dumb facade and he's a lot smarter than he lets on 
90% of the time. I don't think what he said was wrong either I mean when 
they hire British comedians they should know what to expect after the Ricky 
Gervais oscars ordeal. They will poke at all the prickly/touchy topics they 
can get their hands on and won't give a fuck about the consequences because 
as comedians they are intelligent enough to not mean and deliver it in a 
hateful way, they merely pose it as a comment, normally in a sarcastic way. 
Americans and apparently Hugo Boss don't deal with their cynical 
personalities and dry humor it seems. I think that it's also wrong that 
they removed Brand from the event but lets face it, they shot themselves in 
the foot and made it a larger issue by trying to cover it up in that 
manner. I still don't believe they need to actually address the point or 
apologize for it.

+Andrew Beeter - A little thing I wanted to add to Andrew as well is that 
my question of being a Nazi and TRULY being a Nazi are still very different 
things. Now of course this doesn't apply to everyone but how many people do 
you think were coerced or forced to become a Nazi. Oskar Schindler was a 
Nazi on paper and we all know what he was famous for. I always feel these 
matters require a bit of common sense, think about it, Hugo Boss was a 
company manufacturer, what would his business gain by killing Jews? 
Absolutely nothing, if anything he would be losing business and that is 
illogical. I don't blame anyone for joining the Nazi's at the time, when 
every German around them were turning into them. This is what I meant by 
being a Nazi and truly being a Nazi and of course many of them killed Jews, 
but I'm sure that there are still many Germans who became Nazi's because 
they had no choice to conform - lets not forget that that was essentially 
their government regime and under that pretense anyone, ironically even 
Jews themselves would've been counted as Nazi's just for living in Germany. 
I like to at least believe and think that every Nazi wasn't a straight up 
nasty piece of racist/prejudiced shit because life and more to the question 
- good and evil isn't quite that black and white in the real world compared 
to how they are on paper and portrayed throughout history.
comments.author: TheDaneist

comments.text:
Listen TheDaneist, I understand your point of view and I respect it because 
I can see you've put some thought into it. That being said though, I don't 
think Russel said anything that was out of line nor do I think he should 
have been kicked out for his acceptance speech.

His was a clever bit and as a comedian, he played his part well. Hugo Boss, 
on the other hand, handled it quite poorly. It's representatives took 
offense to his comments and had him kicked out, as if what he said was 
wrong or improper. They don't need to apologize for there business with the 
Nazis, but they shouldn't try to cover it up and smooth things over as if 
it never happened either (which is essentially what they did by telling 
Russel to fuck off).  It's poor form, mate.
comments.author: Gavin Gill

comments.text:
+Gavin Gill Listen, if I was a business who had dealings with the Nazi's I 
would still acknowledge that they were wrong, that shouldn't mean I should 
have to apologize for it if I own said business. Not apologizing doesn't 
mean the companies condoned the Nazi's.... It's not something they NEED to 
acknowledge, it is fact. Lets face it, if you owned a successful company 
why would you advertise the fact you had dealings with an organisation like 
the Nazi's... Seriously people, dealing with the Nazi's and BEING Nazi's 
are completely different things. Lets say I owned a general convenience 
store i.e. Wal-Mart and a customer comes in to buy the necessary 
ingredients to make a poison. Then that person goes and poisons thousands 
of people, essentially what you are saying is that the convenience store 
should apologize for supplying the poison ingredients... Don't you 
understand what I'm trying to say here?
comments.author: TheDaneist

comments.text:
+TheDaneist That isn't any way the same thing. America would atone for the 
mistake by acknowledging the piece of history and educating it's citzenry 
on the matter - which it has done (to some degree, at least). Hugo Boss on 
the other hand won't even acknowledge it.
comments.author: Gavin Gill

comments.text:
+Scream & Be Free I disagree because under that logic 90% of America should 
be on their knees begging for forgiveness for African slavery. Should this 
era take responsibility for past era's? I do not agree with this concept in 
the least.
comments.author: TheDaneist

comments.text:
It would only be humane to apologize for anyone who is offended by the fact 
that they made clothes for nazis. Come on. At least address it. Don't have 
to admit to being buddies with Hitler.
comments.author: HeadHeartLungs
